abstract: To the surprise of no one, the American Postal Workers Union's PAC tells the Federal Election Commission that it does not want to receive notices by e-mail.
snippet: To the surprise of no one, the American Postal Workers Union's PAC tells the Federal Election Commission that it does not want to receive notices by e-mail.
lead_paragraph: The Internet may be the new standard for communication, but snail mail still rules at the political action committee of the American Postal Workers Union.

headline.main: Postal Workers PAC Sticks to Regular Mail
